Description: Terracotta figure of a dwarf with jugs. A naked dwarf walking to his right, on a plain curve-fronted plinth. He has very receding hair and wears a leafy wreath backed by a tightly woven wreath, the ribbons of which fall in front of his shoulders. In each hand he carries a jug, perhaps of askos shape. The back is plain, with a circular vent. Hollow; two-piece mould. Micaceous orange-brown Nile silt with a red core.
Curator's comments: BM Terracotta IV Comparandum. Close, probably same mould-series and very probably the same object: Hilton Price 1897: 394, no. 3267, from Bubastis.
Bibliographic references: Terracotta / Catalogue of Terracottas in the British Museum (3176)
